analysis.raw_analysis:
1) Transformation: Height scaled from 6→9 (×1.5) and all 1→2; 0 stays 0.  
2) Pattern: Recolor every 1 to 2, then extend the vertical motif by appending a 3-row repeat found in the input (the 3-row unit with matching first and third rows), producing a longer vertical stripe.  
3) Key changes:  
- Ex1: recolor 1→2; append input rows 2–4 (recolored).  
- Ex2: recolor 1→2; append input rows 2–4 (recolored).  
- Ex3: recolor 1→2; append input rows 0–2 (recolored).

=== INPUT-INPUT COMPARISONS ===
- All inputs are 3 cols ×6 rows, colors {0,1}. A single connected vertical 1-shape with occasional horizontal protrusions varies by example; topology similar (one vertical stroke with 1- or 2-row arms).

=== OUTPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- All outputs are 3×9, colors {0,2}. Every 1→2, 0 stays 0. Height scaled 6→9.

=== INPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Rule for all: recolor 1→2, keep 0, then extend height by appending a 3-row block taken from the input that continues the vertical motif, producing total 9 rows.

- Reference objects: one connected vertical 1-shape (same columns/connectivity) is preserved and guides the change (structure unchanged, only recolored and lengthened).  
- Grid pattern: recolor every 1→2 (0 stays 0). Extend height 6→9 by appending a copy of rows 3–5 (the central 3-row motif) to the bottom.  
- Objects: the vertical bar with occasional L‑protrusions is the key recurring object; its 3-row local motif is what gets duplicated. This fits all examples.

=== GENERAL RULE ===
1) Recolor every 1 → 2 and leave 0 unchanged. 2) Preserve the 3-column object geometry (rows and columns of nonzero pixels) exactly, only changing color. 3) Increase the height from 6 to 9 by appending a copy of the 3-row vertical motif from the input whose first and third rows are identical (the three-row repeating unit of the vertical stripe). 4) The output is therefore a 3×9 grid: the original six rows recolored (1→2) followed by the appended 3-row motif recolored the same way.

general_steps.instruction: Step 1: Recolor every cell that is color 1 to color 2, applied to each distinct object composed only of color 1.
general_steps.condition: Any distinct object (connected region) composed only of color 1 (i.e., all its cells have value 1).

general_steps.instruction: Step 2: Increase the grid height from 6 to 9 by appending a copy of the input's central 3-row vertical motif (input rows 2–4, 0-indexed) to the bottom; when copying the motif, use the same geometry of nonzero pixels as in those rows but with the recolored value (2).
general_steps.condition: Apply to the arrangement formed by all input cells of color 1 (the vertical motif). The central 3-row unit to copy is the one consisting of input rows 2, 3 and 4 (0-indexed), which in the training examples has identical first and third rows.

general_steps.instruction: Step 3: Create any new cells/objects that appear in the appended rows but did not exist in the input, using color 2 and the same spatial pattern as the copied 3-row motif.
general_steps.condition: Any cell position in the appended bottom 3 rows that was empty (color 0) in the input but is occupied by the copied motif pattern.

steps.substep_reasoning: Applying color_mapping to object 1 based on condition: Any distinct object (connected region) composed only of color 1 (i.e., all its cells have value 1).
